meanings.definition: Exhaustion from too much physical or mental exertion.
meanings.sent1: After playing outside all day, the child experienced overfatigue and fell asleep instantly.
meanings.sent2: Her overfatigue was evident from the way she struggled to stay awake during the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The overfatigue of the marathon runner was so extreme that they mistook a tree for a finish line.
meanings.sent4: The overfatigue felt by the student was like carrying a heavy weight on their shoulders all day.
meanings.sent5: The overfatigue after the long hike made every step feel like walking through quicksand.

meanings.sent1: The intense workout session overfatigued her muscles, causing soreness the next day.
meanings.sent2: If you overfatigue yourself, you may not have enough energy for the rest of the day.
meanings.sent3: He managed to overfatigue the puppy with endless games of fetch in the backyard.
meanings.sent4: The long hours of studying overfatigued his brain, making it hard to focus on the test.
meanings.sent5: The repetitive tasks at work can easily overfatigue even the most dedicated employees.
